title: [K-12] Flipped Learning-Based Economics Pedagogy Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic economics concepts and foundational understanding of primary education methodologies
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers strengthen economics instructional content design and delivery skills in flipped learning environments, requiring collaborative learning experiences using BYOD (Bring Your Own Device).

learning_goals: The ability to design economics lessons based on the flipped learning model is achieved, with over 80% of learners providing positive evaluations.
Three or more strategies for creating and applying pre-learning content using digital materials (videos, quizzes, etc.) can be proposed.
Strategies to enhance pedagogical content knowledge (PCK) through peer feedback and social interaction are implemented with over 90% participation.

resources: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) Device-Supporting Infrastructure
Digital Content Library for Economics Education

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
